title: Cognizant asks India employees to work from office thrice a week
description: Cognizant CEO Ravi Kumar S said in a memo last week that all India associates are "expected to be in the office an average of three days per week, or as defined by their team leader," without shedding light on the move's effective date.
content: Following large domestic IT services players, global giant Cognizant Technology Solutions has called its India employees to work from office three times in a week.In a memo sent by Cognizant CEO Ravi Kumar S through an email to its employees few days ago, the US-headquartered IT services and consulting major said it expects India employees to work from the office at least thrice a week.Cognizant wants employees to use the in-person time to prioritise activities that benefit greatly from being together including doing collaborative projects, training and team building exercises.Over the last few months, Cognizantâ€™s homegrown rivals such as Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), Infosys and Wipro have already mandated employees to return to the office in 2023, with a schedule of five days a week, 10 days a month and three days a week, respectively. The push to return to office is being implemented by several IT and technology companies across the country through verbal and formal communication channels.Cognizant will also launch a new hybrid work scheduling app for India to help managers coordinate schedules and reserve space in office for their teams, the email stated.
